docs.lead_paragraph: The President's personal physician says Mr. Bush is in excellent health and has shown the effects of age less than many other Presidents during their first terms. A year ago President Bush said that only a change in his health would deter him from running for a second term. At the time, he was recovering from treatment for an overactive thyroid brought on by Graves' disease, and he seemed politically invincible.

headline.main: THE 1992 CAMPAIGN: Candidate's Health; Bush's Doctor Terms President Strong and Fit
